experience: You and Joe both know Kyle Burnett, Eric Keosky-Smith, and 167 others

Today, we released our #1 most-requested feature over the past few years -- the ability to see keywords by site. Competitors like SpyFy, KeywordSpy, SEMRush, & others have had this for a while, so we're playing catch-up here. But, I think the quality of data, the accuracy of the rankings, and the solid design of the UI (integrated into KW Explorer) help make this a really worthwhile new addition to the suite.
If you've got feedback, I'd love to hear it and so would the team. There's plenty to like here, but a lot that still needs to happen (e.g. it's US-centric right now). Thanks!

Who can consistently do short, current-style, animated / motion graphic video work? Looking for a range of video in the 5-20 second range - mostly animated blog content, studies, etc. Also, might be an opportunity in our marketplace for other customers.

ClearVoice is a content platform enabling brands to create, manage, and amplify content. We've produced a transparent view of the world of content and journalism (just visit clearvoice.com to see for yourself), and give total transparency into the content production process. We build complete content marketing solutions. Create better content.

Dean Garland Corporation is a private consulting firm that helps companies with business process and operations, product development, funding and exit strategy, business development, and sales and marketing.

We create, manage, and promote content assets that live on our customer's websites and social channels. We also leverage our in-house digital PR group to build relationships with influencers and publishers to ensure our customer's message and content is reaching the market, thereby earning brand mentions, social interaction, traffic, and inbound links.
Assisted AZIMA with growth strategy and a local outreach program to help connect employers with employees in Arizona. Great group - happy to be involved.

Managed all aspects of the agency. Over 5-years we grew sales by over 1000%, reduced churn for SEO clients to record lows, and integrated all aspects of search marketing accountability to create a truly holistic search engine marketing agency. Merged into Web.com in early 2007 to form the 4th largest Search firm in the United States.

Managed new business sales strategy, ad agency business development, and worked on the product development team to build first to market service lines. Helped develop a holistic search agency, which regularly ranks as the largest and most capable search marketing firm by Forrester and AdAge.

Developed and co-founded Submitawebsite, Inc. Submitawebsite started out as a simple search engine submission company, but evolved into a sophisticated small-medium business enterprise (SME) SEO firm, catering to over 300 managed clients. Submitawebsite would later be sold to Web.com in 2007 after I returned from my 2.5 year stint at iCrossing.

March 5, 2013, Jazmine reported directly to Joe

Joe is innovation and leadership wrapped in one. He is the CEO that is in the office daily and truly available at all hours for anyone who wants to talk to him. In my time at iAcquire I enjoyed my time spent with Joe, defining the roadmap and negotiating the best path to travel to get where we are going. Joe brings strength in his leadership leading the organization in a firm direction, but also is always open to other opinions and reasons why we should take a different action. Never afraid to roll his sleeves up and jump into any task or job role in the company; Joe is molding the future of iAcquire with his own hands. With Joe and Jay at the helm, iAcquire is definitely a company to watch.
